forkee.name: ALVR-build-test
forkee.description: Stream VR games from your PC to your headset via Wi-Fi

issue.title: Linux needs to be First Party
issue.body:
This software is used mostly by Linux users trying to get their quest 2 and other headsets to connect to their PC, the fact that Linux support is in beta cannot be. It should be a first party.

For Windows and MacOS, people will always default to Virtual Desktop or Oculus' air, as they've much easier installation and/or are the default options. Don't compete with them, its a waste of time

comment.body: Nope it's completely on Valve's side other than the library bits but also half Valve's problem as it's completely broken on native

a new major version of steamVR dropped, seems to have fixed at least a couple of issues with Linux.

Does it change anything for this project?

issue.title: PICO 4 Quality Linux
issue.body:
Can someone tell me settings to improve the quality on Linux with PICO4?
I tried to use this https://github.com/alvr-org/ALVR/wiki/ALVR-in-distrobox. Yep, everything works quickly and clearly,but the quality is poor.
P.S. Maybe not for PICO4. Any of your settings with good quality

comment.body:
Disabling software encoding wouldn't disable it in case of fallback from everything else to it (so if everything fails, it will fallback to it)
And more than 200 mbps being pointless is highly dependent on encoder
HEVC - probably yes, most likely because xr2 g1 doesnt really perform well with it (only up to the point), 
h264 - definitely not, higher bitrate will help a ton on more complex scenes to not make a washed image because of small details.

comment.body:
> Integrated graphics processor is turned off in BIOS and software encoding turned off in ALVR settings
Buuuut what in  ALVR logs?
IT's MUST me like that:
**using VAAPI encoder**
Or some else.
May be u GPU+software don't compatibility whith resolution that u set.
And finally at the end, router and lags. More than 200Mbs bitrate is pointless. What router u use?

issue.title: stuck on "Waiting for server to load" [Mint XFCE]
issue.body:
I was told exactly what to do to use ALVR on linux, but of course it won't work and its stuck on this. What am I missing and are there any alternatives to this program that actually runs.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49694491/187331220-ce8ebfe7-ca89-4a74-bb63-71418fb7a422.png)

comment.body:
> AWNSER: I got it working!!!! here are the steps I did to get it working:
> 
> 1. install Chromium
> 2. Install ffmpeg
> 3. Install SteamVR from Steam and run it once then close it
> 4. close Steam
> 5. download the latest nightly *.appimage
> 6. run the latest nightly *.appimage from the terminal
> 7. Set up and RUN!!!
>    Proof if it working
>    ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71094975/198693555-5ff493b4-494b-492b-bff0-dfd04efe1fc7.png)
>    you can thank me later.

I will really thank you a lot, because I successfully run the steamVR for a lot of times but suddenly it doesnt work.I just shut all the steam things down and then the alvr work normally!!!!!

issue.title: Connecting to ALVR via USB > PC > LAN > Cloud
issue.body:
Hello, I'm trying to implement a USB > PC > LAN > Cloud connection via wired Internet distribution via ADB using gnirehtet.

[Link to project:](https://github.com/Genymobile/gnirehtet)

[Link to operating principle](https://github.com/Genymobile/gnirehtet/blob/master/DEVELOP.md)

The problem is that ALVR gives Time Out even on the local network, although it suggests using "Trust".

The purpose of such a connection is to replace a poor Wifi connection without expensive equipment for further gaming in the cloud.

What to do?

pull_request.title: fix(client): lynx r1 hand tracking
pull_request.body: since ultraleap's service uses a TCP loopback socket you need this additional permission. Now hand tracking works!

issue.title: Steam Container Runtime Support
issue.body:
The recent linux steamvr beta uses a new version of the steam runtime (sniper) based on containers, which prevents alvr from loading (*in the case of a install in system directories, `/home` is still visible by default), this should fix that.

Resources:
- https://gitlab.steamos.cloud/steamrt/steam-runtime-tools/-/blob/main/docs/slr-for-game-developers.md#layout-of-the-container-runtime
- https://gitlab.steamos.cloud/steamrt/steam-runtime-tools/-/blob/main/docs/slr-for-game-developers.md#detecting-the-container-environment

comment.body:
Steamvr 2.0 got out of beta into stable branch.

If you do not update client though (i can't seem to get one yet), then it works even without this pr.
